oai_dc:dc.dc:title: GENERATION CHARACTERISTICS OF WAVE SOUNDS AS A FACTOR OF BEACH AMENITY
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Murakami, Hitoshi
Itoh, Sadahiko
Hosoi, Yoshihiko
Araki, Hideo
Koyabu, Tsuyoshi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: beach amenity
wave sounds
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This study deals with the comfortableness of wave sounds from physiological and psychological aspects. Firstly, the difference of wave sound generation mechanisim between plunging and spilling breakers is discussed on basis of the variation characteristics of sound pressure level and the volume of air bubbles in water. Secondly, the comfortableness of wave sounds is investigated based on the genaration characteristics of the brain wave and the result of questionnaire surveys of auditory test.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
